nl.strohalm.cyclos.dao.accounts
Interface AccountRatesDAO

All Superinterfaces:
BaseDAO<AccountRates>, InsertableDAO<AccountRates>, UpdatableDAO<AccountRates>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AccountRatesDAOImpl
public interface AccountRatesDAO
extends BaseDAO<AccountRates>, InsertableDAO<AccountRates>, UpdatableDAO<AccountRates>

DAO interface for AccountRates. AccountRates are saved on daily basis. If there is already an existing AccountRates for a particular day, that one is used an updated. If none exists for this day or future days, a new AccountRates entity is created.

Author:
rinke

Method Detail

bulkDelete

void bulkDelete(Account account,
                Period period)
Deletes all entities for this account which are in the give period.

Parameters:
account - the account for which this is deleted.
period - You can specify on the Period if the boundaries are to be included or excluded. Normally, you would only want to set the begin date (and have it exclusive).

bulkUpdateWithNull

void bulkUpdateWithNull(Currency currency,
                        Period period,
                        WhatRate whatRate)
performs a bulk update of all the AccountRates, and sets the fields specified in whatRate to null. This is typically performed before a reinitialization.

Parameters:
currency - the currency. It may be advisable to test beforehand if there's only one currency. If so, this param can be null, which will make the query much more efficient.
period - may be null, in which case the query will be much more efficient. You can set the period's inclusiveBegin and inclusiveEnd flags. Normally you'd want to use this with setUseTime to true, only the start specified, and an inclusive begin.
whatRate - speficies the fields to be set to null. RateBalanceCorrection is always set to null, except when nothing is specified in whatRate. In that case the method just returns without doing anything.

getLatestRates

AccountRates getLatestRates(Account account,
                            java.util.Calendar date)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Gets the last AccountRates entity by date. That means:
  • Always gets the last AccountRate available for this account, regardless of what date that is from.
  • If this AccountRate is from the same date as the date parameter, then it is returned.
  • If this AccountRate is of a later date than the date parameter, then we deal with payments in past, so an exception is raised.
  • If this AccountRate is of an earlier date than the date parameter, a new record should be created. A duplicate of the last known AccountRate is made, and returned. Note that this duplicated is NOT persisted, and that the date is NOT reset to the requested date.
So this one is only usefull if you want to persist/update it. Otherwise, use the other method (getRates).

Parameters:
account -
date -
Returns:
a new day record of the account's rates, if needed.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if payment in past.

getLatestReinitializedRates

AccountRates getLatestReinitializedRates(Account account,
                                         java.util.Calendar date,
                                         WhatRate whatRate)
gets the last available non null rates for the specified rate and account, on the same day as the specified end of the period, or earlier. This method is specifically for relooping all transfers in order to reinitialize a rate.
The method checks if there is an entity available on the specified date. If the entity has a null rate for the rate specified in whatRate, then it will return the previous entity (that is: the last available entity of an earlier date). If no entity with a non null rate for the specified whatRate can be found, then it returns a new, blank entity with only null fields.

Parameters:
account -
date - rates should be of this day or earlier.
whatRate - only rates specified in whatRate are considered; any other rates are completely ignored.
Returns:

getRates

AccountRates getRates(Account account,
                      java.util.Calendar date)
gets the latest AccountRates entity.

Parameters:
account -
date - rates newer than this date are not considered. So this method may return an AccountRates entity which is not the latest available. However, this parameter may be null, in which case the latest available should be returned. The date is INCLUSIVE, so rates with exactly the same date are included.

getTodaysRates

AccountRates getTodaysRates(Account account,
                            java.util.Calendar date)
gets the entity only for the specified date. If there is not entity found on that date, then a new one is created, with fields copied from the last available.

Parameters:
account -
date -
Returns:
